snippet: Thousands of men who once held ordinary jobs in Syria have turned into part-time fighters, leaving their refugee families to return to the war.
abstract: Thousands of Syrian men who once held ordinary jobs have turned into part-time rebel fighters, essentially commuting from their lives with their refugee families back to Syria to fight in the civil war; unlike the battle-hardened Islamist combatants who have made rapid gains in the conflict, they fight for weeks at a time and keep in constant touch with their families and return to see them and take care of businesses that may have suffered in their absence.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of men who once held ordinary jobs in Syria have turned into part-time fighters, leaving their refugee families to return to the war.

headline.main: Family Man One Day, Rebel Fighter the Next
headline.print_headline: Family Man One Day, Rebel Fighter the Next
